channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.description: Things are urgent. The coronavirus has reversed decades of progress on global development, putting the world on the brink. To pull back it needs help from those on more solid ground.
item.title: The developing world is a tinderbox as COVID-19 has gutted economies

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, July 16, 2021

item.description: South Africa’s Louis Oosthuizen is all alone atop the leaderboard after round one of the British Open, holding a one-stroke advantage over Jordan Spieth and Brian Harman.
item.title: Oosthuizen in prime position at Open as he chases elusive second major

item.dc:creator: Broede Carmody
item.description: Victorians wake up to a fifth lockdown, Sydney braces for a spike in coronavirus cases and Queensland locks out the families of NRL players.
item.title: Australia news LIVE: Six new cases as Victoria’s lockdown begins; Sydney’s exposure sites continue to grow amid extended shutdown

item.dc:creator: Mathew Dunckley
item.description: Victoria has recorded six new cases of coronavirus on the first day of its fifth lockdown of the pandemic.
item.title: Victoria records six new cases as fifth lockdown begins

item.dc:creator: Anthony Colangelo
item.description: Geelong coach Chris Scott is optimistic there is yet more improvement in his side as finals approach, after the Cats mauled Fremantle.
item.title: ‘Endless search for perfection’: Scott optimistic scary Cats can get even better

item.dc:creator: Adrian Proszenko
item.description: The 2021 Rugby League World Cup may have to go ahead without the Australian Kangaroos, who are yet to sign a participation agreement over safety concerns.
item.title: ‘A long way from committing’: Kangaroos considering World Cup withdrawal

item.dc:creator: Alex Druce
item.description: SPI futures were down 6 points and hinting at a weak start for the S&P/ASX 200. Wall Street was mixed overnight, while iron ore prices rose again.
item.title: ASX set for flat start; Wall Street mixed, iron ore rises

item.description: Oliver Daemen of the Netherlands will be joining Blue Origin founder on the company’s first crewed spaceflight after the winner of a $US28 million auction postponed.
item.title: Scheduling conflict puts 18-year-old on first space flight with Jeff Bezos

item.description: Everything you need to know to find a winner at the mid-north coast meeting.
item.title: Race-by-race preview and tips for Taree on Friday

item.dc:creator: Latika Bourke
item.description: The former PM said she was going to disappoint the London audience, revealing she was hoping to return home herself for Christmas and that she hoped to do home quarantine.
item.title: ‘What would you do?’: Julia Gillard confronted by stranded Australian

item.dc:creator: Cara Waters
item.description: The backers of Australian founded F45 Training are set for a big payday with the fitness giant listing on the New York Stock Exchange.
item.title: Australian fitness giant F45 valued at $2b after Wall Street debut

item.description: Oil may be fast heading for redundancy but it may have a one last sting in the tail for the world economy.
item.title: Oil is on the road to oblivion but can still shock the global economy

item.description: Delta captain Craig Alexander claims the airline rejected his own app for improving crew communication before launching an identical version.
item.title: Delta pilot sues airline for $US1 billion, claiming it ‘stole’ flight crew app

item.dc:creator: Latika Bourke
item.description: China must not be allowed to “sportswash” its genocide of Uighurs, said one MP, referring to the soft power victory Beijing stands to gain from hosting the games.
item.title: ‘Genocide games’: British MPs vote for diplomatic boycott of Beijing Olympics

item.description: First, there’s the enthusiasm for walks. Man now wants to go walking three or four times a day. Even I think: “Come on, mate, steady on, I only sniffed that tree an hour ago.”
item.title: The longer the lockdown, the more we resemble our four-legged friends

item.dc:creator: Farrah Tomazin
item.description: Archbishop Peter Comensoli is facing internal dissent over ambitious plans to restructure almost 200 parishes across the city in a bid to make the church more sustainable.
item.title: Melbourne Catholic Archbishop proposes big church restructure over ‘serious challenges’

item.description: Wall Street investors continue to be focused on where the US economy is headed as the pandemic wanes and also on the latest company earnings reports.
item.title: ASX set to edge lower as Wall Street slides

item.description: In blaming, we are calling on the person we think has wronged us to acknowledge they have acted poorly, to apologise, and change their strategy.
item.title: Why the blame game is an important social tool

item.description: Author Paige Clark was told she should write a story about Kung Fu, reference the I Ching, title a story “Chinese Whispers” and add more ghosts.
item.title: ‘Make this book more Chinese’: My writing wasn’t ‘Asian enough’ to be valued

item.dc:creator: Richard Baker
item.description: Chinese labour hire operator Scott Shi is battling to keep a document confidential as the Australian Tax Office alleges he owes up to $163 million in unpaid taxes.
item.title: Meat industry labour king pursued to High Court over multimillion-dollar tax debt

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: Tribalism is fracturing the federation and yet state voters quite like their premiers standing up to Canberra.
item.title: The new parochialism stifling Australia

item.dc:creator: Sarah Keoghan
item.description: Australian water polo star Hannah Buckling copped a broken eye socket in a spiteful clash against the host nation at the Rio Games - an injury that ultimately stopped her walking away from the sport.
item.title: How a punch in the face in Rio put a fire under Aussie Stinger for Tokyo

item.dc:creator: Andy Marks
item.description: Governments can learn much from Fairfield, and this week they need to pay attention.
item.title: Fairfield, the essential heart of Sydney

item.dc:creator: Lucy Carroll
item.description: About 70 pharmacies in Sydney’s worst affected COVID-19 areas will receive AstraZeneca jabs from next week, with another 365 chemists in metropolitan Sydney set to administer vaccines within the month.
item.title: ‘Pharmacies are ready to go’: Chemists in hotspots fast-tracked to deliver jabs

item.dc:creator: Wendy Tuohy
item.description: In the wake allegations of sexism and lack of support for a student who was groomed by a sex offender coach, St Kevin’s College has examined its culture and vowed to do better.
item.title: St Kevin’s tackles sexism and misogyny that ‘still occur’ in school

item.description: Not even a wedding of five people is legal. Please explain.
item.title: No weddings, just funerals: they’ve quietly outlawed getting married

item.description: Jeff Bezos will give $US200 million to the Smithsonian National Air and Space Museum, marking one of the largest donations by the world’s richest person - days before he takes a trip to space.
item.title: Bezos ‘love affair’ leads to $270 million gift days before space flight

item.description: The pressures of home-schooling in lockdown could tempt a mother to drink, but for this one, this time, it’s Dry July.
item.title: This lockdown, I’m a glass-not-full kind of mum

item.dc:creator: Matt O'Sullivan
item.description: Councils warn the state government’s plans to reform developer levies threatens to strip hundreds of millions of dollars from community projects in Sydney.
item.title: New sport complexes, libraries ‘at risk’ from developer levy shake up

item.description: Leon van Schaik’s new book explores how our personal histories feed into the gardens we grow.
item.title: Percolate, don’t parody: an architect’s guide to gardening from memory

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: A protein found in deadly spider venom could be key in allowing more people to receive donor hearts, as well as helping heart attack victims recover.
item.title: Deadly spider venom could mean new life for heart transplant patients

item.description: Tadej Pogacar claimed another victory in the 18th stage to edge closer to retaining his title, as a cloud of doping suspicions hung over the world’s greatest cycling race.
item.title: Pogacar closes in on title as doping suspicions hit Tour de France

item.description: In a rare departure from his usual deference to powerful member countries, the WHO chief said he was asking China to be more transparent as scientists search for the origins of the coronavirus.
item.title: WHO chief says it was ‘premature’ to rule out COVID lab leak

item.description: At least 42 people have died in Germany as swollen rivers caused by record rainfall across western Europe swept through towns and villages.
item.title: Scores dead, dozens missing as floods sweep through western Europe

item.description: All the ins and outs for round 18 of the 2021 premiership season as they drop and how the expert tipped the round.
item.title: AFL experts tips and teams for round 18

item.description: The latest work by Sydney Morning Herald editorial cartoonist Cathy Wilcox.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Cathy Wilcox

item.description: Gallery of illustrations by Sydney Morning Herald artist, Simon Letch.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Simon Letch

item.description: The 64-year-old, who was widely lauded for his fearless reporting on the underworld, was shot on July 6 after making one of his regular appearances on a current affairs TV show.
item.title: Dutch crime reporter Peter de Vries dies after shooting

item.description: Illustrations by the artist from The Age.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Matt Golding

item.description: Some of his best work
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Andrew Dyson

item.dc:creator: Tim Biggs
item.description: Company directors need to be more accountable when it comes to IT security, experts say, as frequency of ransomware attacks globally continues to escalate.
item.title: Boards set to face the music on cyber security lapses

item.dc:creator: Martin Boulton
item.description: The singer cheekily references the fact that Dance Monkey “went number one in thirty f---ing countries” on Welcome to the Madhouse.
item.title: Tones And I proves she’s no one-hit wonder with debut album

item.dc:creator: Emma Koehn
item.description: Wallabies great John Eales and his unlikely companion medtech expert Stephen Tomisich have big plans for their home-grown success story.
item.title: Rugby star Eales in lineout lifts booming Aussie medtech

item.description: It’s hard to be upbeat and manufacture joy in the office when you’re in the middle of a pandemic.
item.title: The utterly superior response when your boss says: ‘Cheer up!’

item.dc:creator: Anna Patty
item.description: The federal government is spending $45 million to expand a program to helping young people experiencing mental illness to get a job.
item.title: Poor understanding of mental health stifles employment

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Friday, July 16

item.description: Trivia buffs: test your knowledge with today’s interactive superquiz and target.
item.title: Target Time and Superquiz, Friday, July 16

item.description: NSW is in desperate need of specific directions on what constitutes an essential service.
item.title: Common sense not common: clear rules needed in NSW

item.description: Camellias are a temperamental winter flower that need to be treated with TLC.
item.title: Copy of The trick to stop cranky camellias sulking in the Sydney shade
